result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Adam R Hess in court, in custody with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF41 also called - Plea no contest to 15CF99 - Waiver of rights and tendering plea - Waiver free and voluntary - Factual basis exists for plea - Found guilty by court - 15CF41 DRI - Statements by Dunphy/Nocco/Court to sentencing - Defendant may not possess firearms - Defendant may not vote until rights are restored - Sentence withheld - 24 months probation - 90 days jail with huber -  AODA and follow through with recommended treatment - DNA sample/surcharge - CC -  Counseling as recommended by PO - Post conviction rights given

Defendant Adam R Hess in court with attorney James R. Lex.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In receipt of complaint - Waive reading - Dunphy to bail - Time limits for hearing prelim waived -  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Adam R Hess in court, in custody with attorney James R. Lex.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called 11:22am - Motion withdrawn - Close to resolution - Per stipulation there is no Miranda issue -  Hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Not guilty pleas to both counts.

Defendant Adam R Hess in court, in custody with attorney James R. Lex.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer T.T. sworn and testifies. Identifies defendant. Cross by Mr. Lex. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial.

Defendant Adam R Hess in court, in custody via video.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In receipt of complaint - Right to counsel - Waive reading - Dunphy to bail - Sig bond set  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
